author: Noel Nderitu

description: Conversations on theology, music, culture and apologetics hosted by Nairobi-based musician Noel Nderitu.

items.content: A discussion on the thought that all religions ultimately lead to the same end. Featuring Andy Mburu.

items.title: Engaging Culture

items.content: An introduction to what apologetics is all about. Featuring Andy Mburu. We also touch on whether Christianity is the white man's religion and whether the Bible is reliable.

items.title: Apologetics 101

items.content: I've realised plenty times that I loved the things I did more than the one I claimed to do them for. Christian Lwanda helps me process this conversation to help us see when we place Christian Culture ahead of Jesus and how to reverse the order.

items.title: Christian Culture or Jesus?

items.content: I speak on my journey as an independent artist in Nairobi and weigh the benefits against that of a signed act. These are some things that have worked for me. Evaluate your journey and choose what works for you.

items.title: Independent Music Hacks

items.content: Expressions of faith in God through music have become largely popular by mainstream artists. I share some thoughts on this increasing trend with observations from my homeland Kenya and the larger music industry in the West.
